ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.5_0: The second training rule on arms akimbo
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with arms akimbo. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not sit in inhabited areas with arms akimbo,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.4_0: One should not sit in an inhabited area with arms akimbo.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with one or both arms akimbo, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.11_0: if he has entered his dwelling;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.15_0: The second training rule is finished.
